intro: Podosemum agrostideum, commonly known as the grassy podosemum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
